results.title: Burden of dreams
results.brief_description: A documentary by Les Blank which provides a detailed look at the making of the ill-starred five year production of Werner Herzog’s feature film ‘Fitzcarraldo’. Set in the jungle of Peru ‘Fitzcarraldo’ is the story of an opera mad genius (played by Klaus Kinski) who will stop at nothing to achieve his ideal of building an opera house in the middle of the jungle. In many ways the narrative of Fitzcarraldo parallels Herzog’s production experiences. Despite one setback after another in filming: from monsoonal floods to warring native tribespeople, Herzog persisted with his dream until the film was complete. Not a conventional ‘behind-the-scenes’ promotional documentary, but a film which raises the question about the pursuit of art and what it can entail.

results.title: The Siege of Pinchgut
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: Made in Australia by Ealing Studios, this film is concerned with the escape from prison of a man who claims he has been unjustly incarcerated. He escapes and lands on Pinchgut Island in Sydney Harbour, occupies a disused arsenal and defies a police seige by taking the caretaker and his family hostage. Stars Aldo Ray and Heather Sears with Richard Vernon, Grant Taylor and Kenneth Warren. Screenplay by Harry Watt and Jon Cleary.

results.title: Hitler: revenge to ruin
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: This film documents those events during World War II that gradually led to Hitler’s fall from power and eventual suicide inthe face of defeat. Shows Hitler at the apex of his power in 1940. With the defeat of France, Hitler was not content to stop his drive for control of Europe. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: So many voices: a look at abortion in America
results.creator_credit: Victoria Hamburg, DHS Films and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Looks at the issue of abortion in America and the cases for and against abortion in relation to such areas as rape, incest, child abuse, mother’s health and genetic abnormalities. Note that the film is sponsored by the Naitonal Abortion Rights League Foundation Education Project in America and is pro-abortion in its approach. It is therefore strongly recommended that teachers preview the film before screening it to students. Narrated by Ed Asner and Tammy Grimes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: William's doll
results.creator_credit: Roberto Carlo Chiesa and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A young boy finally gets the doll that he has been longing for when his grandfather visits. Intended to show the value of allowing children to grow up without false ideas about masculinity and femininity. Based on the book William’s Doll by Charlotte Zolotow. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: The Three monks
results.brief_description: An animated story about co-operation in which three monks squabble over the chore of fetching water to put out the fire in their temple. Considers the benefit of teamwork as opposed to thinking only of oneself.

results.title: A Queer patient
results.creator_credit: Pu Jia-Xiang and Shanghai Animation Film Studio
results.brief_description: A tale from China centred around the theme of the wolf in sheep’s clothing. A caterpillar admits herself to the animal hospital after becoming ill from eating leaves of protected plants. Unfortunately for her, this is discovered by the medical staff who decide not to let her out. However, the caterpillar metamorphoses into a butterfly and seeks to deceive the hospital staff by playing on the fact that nothing as beautiful as she could do anything destructive. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Mole and the matchbox
results.brief_description: In this animated story, the Mole comes upon a matchbox. The Mole and the Mouse then devise many amusing activities with the box and the matches, accidentally discovering the true purpose of matches. Without narration.

results.title: Lincoln County incident
results.brief_description: A satiric western set in the South Island of New Zealand with a cast and crew of over 100 - all children from a New Zealand secondary school. It involves the escapades of diminutive Sampson Peabody-Jones who, in 1881, heads west in search of adventure and a new life. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Abseiling
results.brief_description: An instructional film on abseiling techniques. Shows how to set up a classic abseil and a standard abseil and illustrates methods of rope control and descent. Presupposes a knowledge of preparatory techniques. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
